{{cpp/ranges/iota_view/title|size}}
{{cpp/ranges/iota_view/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++20|
constexpr auto size() const
    requires (std::same_as&lt;W, Bound&gt; &amp;&amp; /*advanceable*/&lt;W&gt;) {{!!}}
             (/*is-integer-like*/&lt;W&gt; &amp;&amp; /*is-integer-like*/&lt;Bound&gt;) {{!!}}
             std::sized_sentinel_for&lt;Bound, W&gt;;
}}

Returns the size of the view if the view is bounded.

For the definitions of {{c/core|/*advanceable*/}} and {{c/core|/*is-integer-like*/}}, see {{rlpsi|iterator#advanceable}} and {{lti|cpp/iterator/is-integer-like}} respectively.

===Return value===
If any of {{tt|W}} and {{tt|Bound}} is not a [[cpp/iterator/is-integer-like|integer-like type]], returns {{box|{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(}}{{rlpsi|/#bound_}}{{nbspt}}{{c/core|-}}{{nbspt}}{{rlpsi|/#value_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|)}}}}.

Otherwise, returns {{box|
{{c/core|(}}{{rlpsi|/#value_}}{{nbspt}}{{c/core|&lt; 0) ?}}&lt;br&gt;
{{nbspt|4}}{{c/core|(}}&lt;br&gt;
{{nbspt|8}}{{c/core|(}}{{rlpsi|/#bound_}}{{nbspt}}{{c/core|&lt; 0) ?}}&lt;br&gt;
{{nbspt|12}}{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(-}}{{rlpsi|/#value_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|) -}}{{nbspt}}{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(-}}{{rlpsi|/#bound_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|) :}}&lt;br&gt;
{{nbspt|12}}{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(}}{{rlpsi|/#bound_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|) +}}{{nbspt}}{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(-}}{{rlpsi|/#value_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|)}}&lt;br&gt;
{{nbspt|4}}{{c/core|) :}}&lt;br&gt;
{{nbspt|4}}{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(}}{{rlpsi|/#bound_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|) -}}{{nbspt}}{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(}}{{rlpsi|/#value_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|)}}
}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cassert&gt;
#include &lt;ranges&gt;

int main()
{
    unsigned initial_value{1}, bound{5};
    auto i{std::views::iota(initial_value, bound)};
    assert(i.size() == bound - initial_value and i.size() == 4);
    
    auto u{std::views::iota(8)};
    // assert(u.size()); // Error: size() is not present since “u” is unbounded
}
}}
